transcript.title: STATEMENT BY THE PRIME MINISTER, THE HON P.J. KEATING MP VISIT BY THE PRIME MINISTER OF FIJI
transcript.content:
STATEMENT BY THE PRIME MINISTER, TIlE HON P. J. KEATING MP
VISIT BY PRIME MINISTER OF FiJl
The Prime Ministcr of Fiji, the Hon. Sitiveni Rabuka, will visit Australia on 29 August 4
September as a guest of the Government. Prime Minister Rabuka will be accompanied by
Mrs Rabuka, Foreign Minister Bole and officials.
Fiji and Australia have longstanding ties. Fiji is one of our important partners in the South
Pacific and serves as an economic and transportation centre for the region.
I met and held discussions with Prime Minister Rabuka at the recent South Pacific Forum
in Honiara. During the meeting we agreed to resume defence relations between Australia
and Fiji. That move completes normalisation of bilateral relations following Fiji's return
to representative government after elections in May this year.
Prime Minister Rabuka will visit Brisbane, Toowoomba, Sydney and Canberra. He will
have discussions with me and other ministers on bilateral, regional and international issues
of shared concern.
CANBERRA August 1992 .8J -1& AWA IfLt
ARITU 1401
